text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I want to share
with you what I like to call an Indian
spice potato hash it's really easy and
really delicious and if you are used to
or you are a fan of sort of Indian or
Middle Eastern food then chances are you
have all these spices on hand and you
can turn and easy it's sort of standard
breakfast item into something really
spectacular and full of flavor the
ingredients you'll need are the quite a
few spices but like I said if you're
used to making this kind of food then
chances are you have them on hand yellow
mustard seeds cumin seeds coriander
seeds garam masala cumin ground
coriander mango powder chili powder
onion garlic ginger paste or grated
ginger and some potatoes these have been
already cooked because you want your
potatoes to be already about 90% of the
way cooked through because you're just
going to sort of cook them with the
spices and the onions and develop good
color but you're not going to be in the
pan long enough for them to cook
completely otherwise it would get mushy
so you want to just boil them for about
eight to ten minutes depending on the
size in just some cold boiling water
just put water in a pot a pinch of salt
put your potatoes in it and then turn it
on and then it come to a boil and then
boil from that point on for about eight
to ten minutes or like I said until
they're about three quarters of the way
cook through okay you're gonna need some
ghee butter or vegetable oil I prefer
using vegetable oil because it's what I
have on hand at all times
in a large skillet I've got about three
tablespoons of the fat you can use ghee
it traditionally you should but like I
said I don't have it on hand I'm
certainly not going to make a trip to
the grocery store just for that so I
like to use a standard or plain
vegetable oil this is the point while
the oil is still cold that's the time
you add your seeds
what that does it extracts the oils
extracts from the seeds as the oil is
actually warming up and that's when the
flavor is released you will know when
your oil is hot and ready when those
seeds start sort of popping some of them
might fly out of your pan but that's
totally fine at that point we'll add
a few more ingredients and we'll just
kind of keep going it's easy and simple
are you going to love it so just let
that go and then we'll proceed it's
during the pop I'm going to add onion
the garlic and the ginger and I'm just
going to cook these for a few minutes I
want that onion to really cook down just
a little bit if it develops some color
great if it doesn't that's fine cuz it's
really continue cooking at a higher
temperature once we add the potatoes so
don't be too worried about it this is
the point where everything just sort of
becomes fragrant and your whole house is
infused with this wonderful spite all
these like wonderful remove these spices
it's fantastic so let that go for a few
minutes I'm going to add the potatoes it
looks like it's going to be over
crowding the pan but it's fine okay to
have escaped turn this up to about
medium-high and you're going to cook
this while you constantly kind of have
to give these a toss because you want to
make sure that they're developing good
color whether they're not getting mushy
so you're going to need to constantly
toss these around and just keep cooking
them until you see that you're getting
nicely golden brown and that's it season
this with some salt now you're not going
to need all of your spice mixture I just
make a full batch of it because I like
keeping it on hand for any time I want
to makes most sense because this is a
same spice mixture I use when I make my
samosas or when I want to Gorge up my
everyday hash which I don't eat hash
every day but you get the idea I'm going
to give this a stir let them cook for
just a couple more minutes that those
spices can kind of adhere to the
potatoes and all those natural oils come
through in the meantime I am going to
fry up an egg and I may be back here to
show you what it looks like when it's
all done I'm gonna add some scallions
oops and cilantro we really kind of
brightened it up you could add peppers
to this if you wanted to I don't I like
it just like this with Chuck full of
cilantro I don't kind of person that a
little cilantro is good
time is a whole lot better I'm going to
turn that off Oh smells phenomenal I've
got a fried egg I'm telling you you've
got to dip you have got to dip the
spittoon at BARC hold your thoughts
forgot my fork you have got to dip this
potato in an egg yolk I know some people
don't like runny egg yolks but you have
got to try it I am left that on because
that is taking breakfast brunch dinner
whatever to a whole new level and if you
are fan of hash if you are a fan of
those Indian spices this is a recipe
that you will adore honestly admittedly
it's not the most beautiful hash in the
world because it is sort of coverage
with all those spices so it's taking
away some of that white from the potato
but it is so infused it is just crusted
with those whole spices it's phenomenal
the written recipe will be on our in the
kitchen come make it with a fried egg
you will love it I guarantee you I hope
you enjoy spending time with me and I'll
